original_title: IMF team to visit Sri Lanka from May 11 to 23
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – An International Monetary Fund team will Sri Lanka from May 11 to 23, with its Asia Pacific Department Chief Krishna Srinivasan also joining from May 12 to 15, the agency said.
The visit will be “part of regular consultations ahead of the first review mission later this year,” the IMF said.
The IMF’s first review is due in September based on June 2023 data.
RelatedSri Lanka exceeds IMF primary budget balance target for first quarter 2023
Sri Lanka seemed to have reached or exceeded several March 2023 performance criteria, including on inflation, reserve targets and primary balance of the budget. (Colombo/May10/2023)
